intro: Marrubium candidissimum subsp. africanum, commonly known as African white horehound, is a flowering plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its greyish-white, woolly leaves and small blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along rocky outcrops. The species is noted for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
